ygData.subject: RE: Another bard guide idea
ygData.msgSnippet: The outline looks pretty good.  Would you mind sending a complete copy to me at bamadude@hawaii.rr.com? Also,  section II of your outline, minus the playing
ygData.messageBody:
The outline looks pretty good. Would you mind sending a complete copy to me
at bamadude@...?

Also, section II of your outline, minus the playing solo portion, would be
the one appropriate for the Players Guide for Non-bards that I proposed.

Galtin of E'ci

> I also sent an outline to the Guild
> members of a general "Guide Book" for all classes that we could give to
> Members and new "hires". I am sure that every class will want impute and
> it will be a valuable reference. I have "pasted" the outline I emailed
> to the membership yesterday for their comment.
> Feel free to copy it if you wish.
> Moonflower's Ol'man, Olmoss
> -------
> Rising Phoenix GUIDEBOOK to Norrathian Living
> I Introduction
> - a guide, information not "rules"
> - to make our family prominent and sought after companions
>
> II Classes and Their Play
> - each classes presents here
> - Playing solo
> - Playing in a group
> - How other classes can support
> - How to be a good group member
>
> III Building and Leveling Characters
> - Abilities
> - Skills
> - Balancing Armor and Weapons
> - Avocations and Trade Skills
>
> IV Leadership
> - When and how to start a group
> - Choosing members
> - Loot order
> - Handling of "Named" spawns
> - Diplomacy with neighbors
> - Group Discipline, Counseling
> - Dropping a member and ending a group
>
> V Questing
>
> VI Dungeons
> - Ratings and Recommendations
> - guides
>
> VII Leveling
>
> VIII Enhancing your Experience
> - Using News lists
> - Using Internet Voice Communications
> - Organizing Information
>
